title: Thanks to all who bought my cards for the smooth dealings
author: Chicago206

posts.post_title: Thanks to all who bought my cards for the smooth dealings
posts.post_content:
Just completed the set, and while it was fun, its just not much fun without being able to discuss cards with others. Since it seems that more people want to fight than talk cards on both here AND over on CU, I have decided to part ways with both forums as well as with my collection. Below is a list. Some of these backs can be seen in my "rare backs" thread. I can produce scans of the others on request. Rather sell here than on ebay. Prices are shipped...break on 2 or more cards obviously.

Drum Rube Kroh PSA 2---$2540.....Unavailable
Lenox Happy Smith PSA 2---$850....SOLD
BL350 Purtell SGC 10 ---$310.........SOLD
CB Dineen SGC 30---$395..............SOLD
Hindu brown Bergen PSA 2---$360...SOLD
Cycle 460 Sheckard PSA 4---$200...SOLD
Cycle 350 Arellanes SGC 40---$120...SOLD
AB 460 Geyer SGC 50---$325...........SOLD
AB 350 (Fm) O'Brien SGC 60---$290...SOLD
AB 350 (no Fm) McQuillan PSA 3---$95....SOLD


Total on all is $5485....Will sell the whole lot at $5,000 DLVD if someone wants it. All payments must be either Paypal "gift", or USPS money order. Responses IN THIS THREAD will get priority. Thanks.


Scan of the Lenox per request:
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/Lenoxf.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/SmithLenoxb.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/drumpied42.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/drumpied42b.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/3absandacyclef.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/3absandacycleb.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/hindublf.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i220.photobucket.com/albums/dd37/geckster109/hindublb.png[/IMG]

posts.post_title: Re: T206 Rare backs for sale
posts.post_content:
Hello,
I am interested in the T206 Smith with Lenox back. Can you send me a scan?
Thanks,
Art M.
I'll take the Lenox if still available. PM sent on the drum and cycle 460, Phil.
I will post scans of all available cards in this thread. At that time, its a free for all. Please hold all offers till I get the scans up. Your patience is greatly appreciated!

I see that thread responses take precedence over email....I'm interested in the Lenox and cycle 460...drum I want to see first...

EDIT: I guess I was typing my message while you were posting yours...
Lenox has sold...its now open season!

I'll take the cycle. Is the Lenox mine? You said that this thread took priority.

Edited to add that there is no drum scan that I can see...

[quote name="JP" post=797249]I'll take the cycle. Is the Lenox mine? You said that this thread took priority.[/QUOTE]



The cycle is yours, and the posts in this thread DO take priority, thats why the guy ahead of you in this post gets the card. PM me for payment details.
PM sent on Cycle 350

Phil, I'll just paypal gift to the email address you've sent past payments to me from. Still no drum scan...and by that I mean the back scan of the drum is not coming up on my iPhone while everything else is visible.

[quote name="JP" post=797260]Phil, I'll just paypal gift to the email address you've sent past payments to me from. Still no drum scan...[/QUOTE]

The Drum is there....just look a bit closer...near the top.


Cycle 460 sold!

[quote name="JP" post=797260] Still no drum scan...[/QUOTE]



The Drum is in the 3rd and 4th picture down. Refresh your page.
Hindu sold!

[quote name="Chicago206" post=797266]The Drum is there....just look a bit closer...near the top.[/QUOTE]

Yeah, I could tell SOMETHING was there.  For some reason all of the other pictures on my iPhone were loading, but that wasn't, and it was leaving a little blue box with a question mark in it.  Just got home, and on a regular computer the pic comes up just fine.....weird.

Anyway, any chance you can e-mail me a closer scan of the Drum?  I'll PM you as well....thx!

[quote name="JP" post=797286]Yeah, I could tell SOMETHING was there.  For some reason all of the other pictures on my iPhone were loading, but that wasn't, and it was leaving a little blue box with a question mark in it.  Just got home, and on a regular computer the pic comes up just fine.....weird.

Anyway, any chance you can e-mail me a closer scan of the Drum?  I'll PM you as well....thx![/QUOTE]


I dont have that capability...im very computer stupid. Im great with a digital camera, but horrible with a scanner....these are the very best I can do.
Oh, o.k.  On the Drum, in the top right corner of the back, is that a bleed of blue ink, or a stain or is that the image coming through....I'm squinting but the pic won't get bigger.  ;)

[quote name="JP" post=797289]Oh, o.k.  On the Drum, in the top right corner of the back, is that a bleed of blue ink, or a stain or is that the image coming through....I'm squinting but the pic won't get bigger.  ;)[/QUOTE]


That is a blue stain of some sort. No idea what caused it though. A very light portion of that stain does bleed through to the front of the card as well, now that I really look at it.
:p

[quote name="mintacular" post=797293]I am very confused, I read Gecko's thread on PSAs website where he says that he owns none of the tobacco cards he has scanned there and here, that the only cards he actually owns are 1987 Kevin Mitchells.  That all of his "cards" are actual stolen scans...[/QUOTE]

Pat, I'm pretty sure he was being sarcastic....

Phil, payment sent on the Cycle, thanks!!!
Theres always at least 1 idiot in the bunch!:D

[quote name="mintacular" post=797295]I guess, I mean he copped to lying about his job/wife, etc. but I thought he was also admitting that he doesn't have these cards either....[/QUOTE]

Dude, this is his BST thread....leave him alone.  I mean he is leaving the hobby because of stuff like this.  He obviously has the cards, the rest is irrelevant here, no?

I will take the Cycle 350.
                   Thanks,
                    Steve

[quote name="soxinseven" post=797308]I will take the Cycle 350.
                   Thanks,
                    Steve[/QUOTE]



Its yours.
I smell a fish...

[quote name="Marty" post=797326]I smell a fish...[/QUOTE]


Yet another PERFECT example of why im exiting the hobby and these forums.
What is so "fishy"? Please explain that if my intentions were to rip people off, surely there would be a better way to do it rather than a big blowout? Correct? I would sneak in, make a few jovial posts, and then BAM! Thats how i'd do it if I were a thief. You think i'd make a huge stink, and then admit im leaving this forum and THEN try to BST my cards and not deliver? Wow!
I would like this card if it is available.
So you are saying that you are an honorable douchebag?

[quote name="lsutigers1973" post=797341]So you are saying that you are an honorable douchebag?[/QUOTE]


My word is golden...maybe my attitude isnt though. Either way, I've had enough of the BS. Maybe i'll go buy the family a boat instead. Spending more time with my wife and son beats fighting with morons anyday of the week.

As per the forum rules:  In the B/S/T area there should be no interference in the posts by 3rd parties...this includes, but is not limited to, talking about what someone paid for something. Only persons involved in the transaction should be posting but benign comments can be ok. If you don't know the difference then don't post. Also, if any fraudulent activity is known about it can be posted in the BST threads, pertaining to that item, by 3rd parties. This is for the protection of the board. Caveat Emptor still is in effect. 

I've already given one infraction, the next person that chimes in here with an insult or interferes with this thread will also get one.

We're starting to see the influence of the recent migration of some CU Forum members to this board.   This kind of stuff goes on all the time over there - a lot of nasty, unprovoked attacks and hate posts.    They've made the environment unbearable over there for quite some time and now their looking for a new forum environment that they can pollute.   You can pick them out of this post.  Mods beware.
I'll take the Purtell BL if still available.

[quote name="usernamealreadytaken" post=797462]I'll take the Purtell BL if still available.[/QUOTE]


Shes yours.:D

Chicago

I sent you a PM.

Thanks.

Scott

All paid orders to date have been shipped. If you have paid me, your card is in the mail. I want to thank each of you for this smooth transition, and I sincerely hope you get much more enjoyment out of the cards than I did! Thanks again.
Still have the Kroh Drum and a couple of AB's including the scarce 460 variety.

posts.post_title: I don't know Chicago ... I hope you don't regret this .....
posts.post_content:
[quote name="Chicago206" post=797681] and I sincerely hope you get much more enjoyment out of the cards than I did! Thanks again.[/QUOTE]

*

I don't buy the above statement.

If you didn't enjoy them, you wouldn't have bought them.

After the sale, there's no reason whatsoever for you to stick around the board.

That is unless you have allowed some meatballs to get the best of you, just when you were so close to having a complete t206 back set?

Lots of luck, and again I say, I hope you don't regret the sell off.

Joe
What is the point of the above statement?

[quote name="usernamealreadytaken" post=798087]What is the point of the above statement?[/QUOTE]

*

Tell me, which part don't you understand?

Are you Chicago206?

[quote name="Potomac Yank" post=798080]*

I don't buy the above statement.

If you didn't enjoy them, you wouldn't have bought them.

After the sale, there's no reason whatsoever for you to stick around the board.

That is unless you have allowed some meatballs to get the best of you, just when you were so close to having a complete t206 back set?

Lots of luck, and again I say, I hope you don't regret the sell off.

Joe[/QUOTE]



I did enjoy them....putting the complete 15 card basic backs set together was one of the most fun things I have ever done. When I bought the above mentioned Drum in Rosemont, I was stuck in a traffic jam for 90 minutes going home. I literally got a headache because I couldnt stop smiling!!! In fact, although I have already sold off the majority of my cards in the past 48 hours, a big part of me wants to just put this card away and forget about it. The one sure thing I know about myself is that my interest in things is very cyclical. So if I ever DO want to get back into the hobby, I'd at least have one heckuva start!!! I actually may do this if the card doesnt sell by Saturday. Thats my 35th birthday, and its hard to imagine a better gift to myself than this card. If someone does snag it before then, im certain they will get alot of enjoyment out of owning it. And im young enough to be able to easily get back into the hobby from square 1 anyway. Took me just 4 months to complete the 1st goal I set for myself. Might take 4-6 months to repeat if I find the interest in doing so again.

phil...
for accepting my offer.
i am genuinely sorry that your t206 experience was so alienating...
i bought my first in 1964 (at the age of 13), and these cards have been a persistant passion ever since!
you & your raw excitement will be missed in the t206 community, and i sincerely hope that you'll return sometime in the future.
best wishes,
mark
ps- payment will be completed tomorrow am, after i deposit funds.

posts.post_content:

Chicago, this is a statement that I believe, but I doubt if usernametaken will understand what we're talking about.
We're on the same page.

If the card is meant to stay ... It would be a hell of a re start. :)
There's only a handfull on this board that understand what we're talking about.

Don't let the meatballs get to you ... that's all they're good at, and they fail whenever they're confronted. 
At 79, and from NYC, I've been there a few times. :)

With, or without the Drum .....  have a Happy Birthday!

Joe Pelaez

Joe:

Stop your interference. It's getting tiresome.

Steve

Members of the jury:
Does anyone know what Steve is talking about?

Oh I forgot ... he's a Real Estate lawyer. :)

I worked with you guys back in the '60's, but they were good, and on top of their game.

Joe P just got an infraction for his escapades in this thread. Anymore interference in this thread, by anyone, and it will be a suspension from the BST. If you are not buying or selling a card then stay out of it please.

Hello Phil,
Just letting you know that the T206 Lenox card arrived.  Thanks for the fast shipping, smooth deal, and nice card.
Regards,
Art M.

[quote name="rebelsart" post=798514]Hello Phil,
Just letting you know that the T206 Lenox card arrived.  Thanks for the fast shipping, smooth deal, and nice card.

Art M.[/QUOTE]



Thanks for the smooth deal as well Art!  The Drum remains available until Sunday morning (when I get home from the firehouse). If its not sold by then, it becomes my 35th B-day present to myself!
